Contentment!  sweet propitious pow'r,</br>Thou soft'ner of the human woe,</br>Dear partner of the adverse hour,</br>Whom Happiness is bound to know;</br>Charm'd by thy soft persuasive tongue,</br>The tortur'd soul takes comfort long,</br>And Poverty is taught to find</br>New treasures hid before, to sooth her suff'ring mind.

When infant Virtue first, from heav'n,</br>Jove to Adversity consign'd,</br>Thou, as a constant mate, wast giv'n,</br>And bade to ease her burden'd mind.</br>Soft pleasing friend!  thy sweet'ning care</br>Taught her the rigid scourge to bear;</br>In thee a partner of her grief she found,</br>Whence healing comfort flow'd, like balm to ev'ry wound.

From thy sweet smiles, abash'd retire</br>Self tort'ring Envy, and Despair,</br>Fierce Hopes, and covetous Desire,</br>And leave us calm 'midst crouds of care.</br>Quick they depart, and with them fly</br>False Pleasure, and deluding Joy;</br>By wild Ambition cherish'd still,</br>And seem a while obedient to her tow'ring will.

Patience slow moving, and sedate,</br>With piercing eye that views from far,</br>And Hope, with future joys elate,</br>That gently drives her steady carr,</br>In all thy labours acquiesce:</br>Humility, that Christian grace,</br>Still conscious of her own defects,</br>And Faith, believing maid, whom Charity protects.

Fair goddess, with benignant smiles,</br>Thy modest votary assist;</br>If Virtue recompense my toils,</br>'Tis impious dulness to desist.</br>For me thy kindest beams prepare,</br>That I each harmless joy may share,</br>And able wisely to discern,</br>View providential care in every changing turn.

Bright power!  retrieve my sinking breast,</br>Descend, and dwell sole regent there;</br>Far hence be anxious Thought distrest,</br>Green Jealousy, and mute Despair;</br>Teach me, with comfort, to enjoy</br>Life's competent benignity,</br>Not pamper'd with luxurious ease</br>To covet more and more, but thank kind heav'n for these.</br>
